result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Alma Burchfield

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD / 10:35 AM Defendant Melissa Alma Burchfield in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Melissa Alma Burchfield.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attny Pollak indicates offer has been received, needs to review with DEF and see about resolution.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Plea/Schedule scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Melissa Alma Burchfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Conner Hanson (Intern)  court for Melissa Alma Burchfield.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Hanson acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Melissa Alma Burchfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Melissa Alma Burchfield.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness Sawyer County Deputy Ian Hall, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.  10:13 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.   10:14 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.   10:16 AM  Attny Pollak no further questions.  10:16 AM Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak makes argument and requests dismissal.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Pollak indicates bond modification was filed and requests bond modification argument.    State makes argument.   Attny Pollak continues argument.  Court denies bond motion.
Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Melissa Alma Burchfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Melissa Alma Burchfield.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak recently appointed, unable to review complaint with DEF.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.   Through Attny, DEF request to set preliminary hearing within time limits.  DEF request bond modification,  Court informs Attny to argue bond at time of preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
DEF Melissa A Burchfield in court, appearing by video from custody in the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance). Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and Address.  DEF does qualify for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court sets INIT for 05/31/2022 at 10:00AM.  

CBS $1000 - ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
